Content: Defines 'performance' as any visual or acoustic presentation made live by one or more performers.

Defines 'performer' to include actors, singers, musicians, dancers, acrobats, lecturers, etc. Includes a proviso excluding casually incidental performers in cinematograph films (unless credited) from full rights except under Section 38B.
Defines 'visual recording' as the recording of moving images or representations in any medium, including electronic storage.
Exclusive rights of performers include: making sound/visual recordings, reproducing recordings, issuing copies, communicating recordings to the public, and commercial rental/sale of recordings.
Exclusive right to broadcast/communicate the performance to the public unless already broadcast.
Performer cannot object to producer’s commercial exploitation of their performance in a cinematograph film after written consent, unless contract states otherwise.

Performer’s moral rights include: (a) right to be identified as the performer, and (b) right to restrain/prevent distortion/mutilation prejudicial to reputation. Modifications for technical reasons (e.g., editing) are exempt.
Acts not infringing performers’ rights: private/educational recordings, fair dealing for current events/reviews, and acts permitted under Section 52 (e.g., adaptations).

Extends provisions like assignment (Sections 18–19), licensing (Sections 30–30A), civil remedies (Section 55), and anti-piracy measures (Sections 53–66) to performers’ rights. Provisos: (1) No broadcast license without performer’s consent; (2) No rights if performance infringes existing copyright.
Indian government may extend performers’ rights to foreign countries reciprocally.
Restrictions may apply to foreign organizations/countries that do not protect performers’ rights.
Mandates licensing via Copyright Societies (e.g., IPRS) for public performances. Requires assignment of rights to societies for administration.

Third and Fourth Provisos: Performers retain inalienable right to royalties for commercial use of their performances, even if incorporated into films. Royalties must be equally shared with producers unless assigned to heirs/collecting societies.
